text: Alastair "Ali" Brownlee (1959 - 14 February 2016) was a English radio broadcaster. He was born in Middlesbrough, North Riding of Yorkshire. He was best known for his coverage of Middlesbrough Football Club on BBC Tees from 1982 onwards. His connection to the club earned him the honorific "Voice of the Boro". Brownlee was a bank manager before becoming a sports commentator. Brownlee died on 14 February 2016 at a hospital in Linthorpe, Middlesbrough, North Yorkshire. He had suffered from bowel cancer for three months. He was aged 56. ==References== ==Other websites== * End of an era for radio duo Category:1959 births Category:2016 deaths Category:British bankers Category:BBC radio presenters Category:Cancer deaths in England Category:Deaths from colorectal cancer Category:Disease-related deaths in Yorkshire Category:English radio personalities Category:People from Middlesbrough Category:English sports commentators Category:Sportspeople from Yorkshire
title: Ali Brownlee
